msContents.summary: The Ñāṉamuyaṟci, that is, Spiritual Exercises by Carlo Michele Bertoldi (1662-1740), inspired by Ignatius of Loyala’s Spiritual Exercises. See Trento (forthcoming): not a translation, literal or otherwise, [...] rather a book of meditations inspired by the Exercises but meant to be read by the retreatants, unlike Ignatius’ text, meant for the priest giving the exercises.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to 1750 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

acquisition.p: It appears to be the paper Le Gnana moarchi, Livre pour donner la retraitte spirituelle and Gnana moarchi sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1730 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in ancien lists (BnF NAF 5442, f5r and f9r).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 66.
S.n. (1739). Catalogus codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecae regiae. Tomus primus. Pars prima, complectens codices manuscriptos orientales. Paris: Typographia Regia. — See n° XXIV, p. 434.
Trento, Margherita (forthcoming). Writing Tamil Catholicism: A Social History of Persuasion and Devotion in the eighteenth Century.

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). ― Abbreviations ― c = column, f = folio, lf = library foliation = lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
